t: John 18
When*p Jesus had spoken these words, he went forth with his disciples over the brook Cedron, where was a garden, into the which he entered, and his disciples.
And*p Judas also, which betrayed him, knew the place: for Jesus ofttimes resorted thither with his disciples.
Judas*p then, having received a band of men and officers from the chief priests and Pharisees, cometh thither with lanterns and torches and weapons.
Jesus*p therefore, knowing all things that should come upon him, went forth, and said unto them, Whom*r seek*r ye?*r
They*p answered him, Jesus of Nazareth. Jesus saith unto them, I*r am*r he.*r And Judas also, which betrayed him, stood with them.
As*p soon then as he had said unto them, I*r am*r he,*r they went backward, and fell to the ground.
Then*p asked he them again, Whom*r seek*r ye?*r And they said, Jesus of Nazareth.
Jesus*p answered, I*r have*r told*r you*r that*r I*r am*r he:*r if*r therefore*r ye*r seek*r me,*r let*r these*r go*r their*r way:*r
That*p the saying might be fulfilled, which he spake, Of*r them*r which*r thou*r gavest*r me*r have*r I*r lost*r none.*r
Then*p Simon Peter having a sword drew it, and smote the high priest's servant, and cut off his right ear. The servant's name was Malchus.
Then*p said Jesus unto Peter, Put*r up*r thy*r sword*r into*r the*r sheath:*r the*r cup*r which*r my*r Father*r hath*r given*r me,*r shall*r I*r not*r drink*r it?*r
Then*p the band and the captain and officers of the Jews took Jesus, and bound him,
And*p led him away to Annas first; for he was father in law to Caiaphas, which was the high priest that same year.
Now*p Caiaphas was he, which gave counsel to the Jews, that it was expedient that one man should die for the people.
And*p Simon Peter followed Jesus, and so did another disciple: that disciple was known unto the high priest, and went in with Jesus into the palace of the high priest.
But*p Peter stood at the door without. Then went out that other disciple, which was known unto the high priest, and spake unto her that kept the door, and brought in Peter.
Then*p saith the damsel that kept the door unto Peter, Art not thou also one of this man's disciples? He saith, I am not.
And*p the servants and officers stood there, who had made a fire of coals; for it was cold: and they warmed themselves: and Peter stood with them, and warmed himself.
The*p high priest then asked Jesus of his disciples, and of his doctrine.

Jesus*p answered him, I*r spake*r openly*r to*r the*r world;*r I*r ever*r taught*r in*r the*r synagogue,*r and*r in*r the*r temple,*r whither*r the*r Jews*r always*r resort;*r and*r in*r secret*r have*r I*r said*r nothing.*r
Why*rp askest*r thou*r me?*r ask*r them*r which*r heard*r me,*r what*r I*r have*r said*r unto*r them:*r behold,*r they*r know*r what*r I*r said.*r
And*p when he had thus spoken, one of the officers which stood by struck Jesus with the palm of his hand, saying, Answerest thou the high priest so?
Jesus*p answered him, If*r I*r have*r spoken*r evil,*r bear*r witness*r of*r the*r evil:*r but*r if*r well,*r why*r smitest*r thou*r me?*r
Now*p Annas had sent him bound unto Caiaphas the high priest.
And*p Simon Peter stood and warmed himself. They said therefore unto him, Art not thou also one of his disciples? He denied it, and said, I am not.
One*p of the servants of the high priest, being his kinsman whose ear Peter cut off, saith, Did not I see thee in the garden with him?
Peter*p then denied again: and immediately the cock crew.

Then*p led they Jesus from Caiaphas unto the hall of judgment: and it was early; and they themselves went not into the judgment hall, lest they should be defiled; but that they might eat the passover.
Pilate*p then went out unto them, and said, What accusation bring ye against this man?
They*p answered and said unto him, If he were not a malefactor, we would not have delivered him up unto thee.
Then*p said Pilate unto them, Take ye him, and judge him according to your law. The Jews therefore said unto him, It is not lawful for us to put any man to death:
That*p the saying of Jesus might be fulfilled, which he spake, signifying what death he should die.
Then*p Pilate entered into the judgment hall again, and called Jesus, and said unto him, Art thou the King of the Jews?
Jesus*p answered him, Sayest*r thou*r this*r thing*r of*r thyself,*r or*r did*r others*r tell*r it*r thee*r of*r me?*r
Pilate*p answered, Am I a Jew? Thine own nation and the chief priests have delivered thee unto me: what hast thou done?

Jesus*p answered, My*r kingdom*r is*r not*r of*r this*r world:*r if*r my*r kingdom*r were*r of*r this*r world,*r then*r would*r my*r servants*r fight,*r that*r I*r should*r not*r be*r delivered*r to*r the*r Jews:*r but*r now*r is*r my*r kingdom*r not*r from*r hence.*r

Pilate*p therefore said unto him, Art thou a king then? Jesus answered, Thou*r sayest*r that*r I*r am*r a*r king.*r To*r this*r end*r was*r I*r born,*r and*r for*r this*r cause*r came*r I*r into*r the*r world,*r that*r I*r should*r bear*r witness*r unto*r the*r truth.*r Every*r one*r that*r is*r of*r the*r truth*r heareth*r my*r voice.*r
Pilate*p saith unto him, What is truth? And when he had said this, he went out again unto the Jews, and saith unto them, I find in him no fault at all.
But*p ye have a custom, that I should release unto you one at the passover: will ye therefore that I release unto you the King of the Jews?
Then*p cried they all again, saying, Not this man, but Barabbas. Now Barabbas was a robber.
